intro: Lampranthus fergusoniae, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces showy, often fiery-colored bracts that are mistaken for petals, enhancing its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Lampranthus fergusoniae is also known for its ability to survive in arid conditions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
